Posts.Content: Oct 12, 2012 11:13PM hconnor wrote: My mom was DX in 2005. 2007 it spread outside the chest(metas). She has been on tykerb and xeloda since then. Her scans/petscan/MRI/CAT have always came out great the doc says. She does have some side effects like, dizziness, headaches, loss of appitite, shortness of breath, andÂ tingling in her feet and hands. Now she has moved to a differ state and has a new Oncologist who suggests that she stops the medications because he can not see anything on her most recent scan. He said long term of these drugs can gave serious side effects. One is heart problems which my mom already has. He is giving her the option to continue or stop. We could really use some advice. Oh and another big concern is that if she decided to stop treatment then her insurance(medicaid) will drop her then she will not have insurance at all!! What should we do? Anyone with similar experience? Thank You in advance. Worried daughter
Posts.Title: Xeloda and Tykerb janicemarie3 hconnor
